'Chinhoyi University of Technology' also known as 'CUT' was established by an
Act by the Parliament of Zimbabwe on 10 December 2001. The town of Chinhoyi is
in Mashonaland West about 120 km from Harare towards Lake Kariba and the Zambian
border. [http://www.cut.ac.zw/ABOUTCUT/aboutcut.html About us CUT]

The Chinhoyi University of Technology has grown out of the Chinhoyi Technical
Teachersâ College that was founded in 1991. The first-degree programmes were
offered in 1999 under the control of the University of Zimbabwe. Soon
afterwards, in 2001, the institution gained full university status.

Today, the university provides undergraduate courses in the fields of
agriculture, engineering, and business sciences. Technical teacher education,
and creative art and design, are offered through the universityâs single
institute, the Institute of Lifelong Learning. With nearly 3 000 students and an
academic staff of 163, the university describes itself as âa small but highly
selective institutionâ.

A Strategic Management postgraduate masters programme was introduced in 2005,
and âcontinues to flourishâ, a claim that warrants respect when the records show
that 62 masters degrees were conferred in 2008, alongside the nearly 700
undergraduate degrees. In addition, a new school is being planned, the School of
Hospitality and Tourism, which as part of its academic programme will run a
hotel existing on the experimental farm as a commercial venture. The university
is there to serve a great purpose to the whole
